meanings.sent1: The cold wind benumbing my fingers.
meanings.sent2: The dentist used a numbing gel to benumb my gums before the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so benumbing that the audience couldn't feel their own hands.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous lecture had a benumbing effect on the students' attention spans.
meanings.sent5: The icy water was so benumbing that it felt like tiny needles on my skin.

meanings.definition: To cause to lose feeling or awareness.
meanings.sent1: The loud music benumbing my ability to hear clearly.
meanings.sent2: The strong medication can benumb the patient's senses temporarily.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotist's words were so benumbing that the audience fell into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent4: The shocking news had a benumbing impact on the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The dense fog was so benumbing that it obscured everything in sight.
